channel.title: Perl Video Tutorials
channel.description: Perl video tutorials for new to advanced programmers.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 1 - Active Perl, Perl Editor, Hello World (3:46)
item.description: Part 1 features details on where to download Active Perl, where to download a good Perl Editor and how to say 'Hello World'.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 2 - Program Basics (0:45)
item.description: Part 2 covers the very basics of scripting. Opening and exiting a program.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 3 - Variables (5:10)
item.description: Part 3 explains variables with basic examples.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 4 - Arrays: Basics (7:17)
item.description: Part 4 covers arrays. How to create, print, grow, shrink and empty an array.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 5 - Arrays: push, pop, shift, unshift (5:44)
item.description: Part 5 covers more array functions. How to push, pop, shift and unshift an array.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 6 - Arrays: merge, reverse, sort (6:43)
item.description: Part 6 covers more array functions. How to merge, reverse and sort an array.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 7 - Array Tips (4:34)
item.description: Part 7 offers a few tips and shortcuts for creating arrays.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 8 - Looping Arrays: The Foreach Loop (6:50)
item.description: Part 8 explains looping arrays with the foreach loop.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 9 - Conditionals: if, elsif, else, unless (5:49)
item.description: Part 9 shows basic conditional statements: if, elsif, else and unless.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 10 - Operators and Precedence (10:00)
item.description: Part 10 covers operators and precedence. Addition, multiplication, division, subtraction and auto-increment/auto decrement of numbers.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 11 - Operators and Precedence Continued (8:26)
item.description: Part 11 covers operators and precedence. Modulus, power of, use integer, ==, !=, eq, ne.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 12 - The While Loop, The Until Loop (8:11)
item.description: Part 12 explains the while loop and the reverse while loop, the until loop.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 13 - Functions: map, grep (6:52)
item.description: Part 13 explains the functions map and grep. Examples of how they can be applied to arrays.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 14 - Hashes: Basics (8:16)
item.description: Part 14 explores hashes. How to create hashes and reference each key/value pair.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 15 - Looping Hashes: keys, values, each (4:43)
item.description: Part 15 shows how to loop through hashes with the each, keys and values functions.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 16 - Hash Functions: exists, defined, delete (5:41)
item.description: Part 16 shows hash functions exists, defined and delete.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 17 - Hashes: reverse, sort, merge (6:10)
item.description: Part 17 shows how to reverse the key/value pairs of a hash, sort hashes and merge hashes.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 18 - Functions: split, join (6:09)
item.description: Part 18 explains the split and join functions.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 19 - Functions: lc, uc, lcfirst, ucfirst (6:56)
item.description: Part 19 shows the functions lc, uc, lcfirst, ucfirst and a method to ucfirst every word in a string.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 20 - Functions: length, substr, index, rindex (9:32)
item.description: Part 20 shows the functions length, substr, index and rindex.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 21 - Random Numbers & Rounding: rand, sprintf (7:54)
item.description: Part 21 shows how to generate and use random numbers with the rand function and how to round numbers to any decimal place with the sprintf function.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 22 - What's The Time? (8:17)
item.description: Part 22 shows how to use the time function to format the time simply and in a more advanced way.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 23 - Commenting Your Code (4:58)
item.description: Part 23 shows how to comment and label your code.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 24 - Regular Expressions: Basics (10:00)
item.description: Part 24 explains the most basic regular expressions.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 25 - Subroutines: Basics (9:51)
item.description: Part 25 shows the basics of subroutines. Continue with Perl tutorial 88 next!

item.title: Perl Tutorial 26 - Open, Read & Close a Text File (6:17)
item.description: Part 26 shows how to open, read, and close a text file.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 27 - Write To & Append a Text File (6:06)
item.description: Part 27 shows how to write to and append a text file.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 28 - Rename, Copy & Delete Files, File Size (5:39)
item.description: Part 28 shows how to rename, copy and delete files. Plus how to use the stat function to get the size of a file.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 29 - Directories: Open, Read, Make & more (7:06)
item.description: Part 29 shows how to open, read, close, make, change and remove directories.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 30 - Glob Function (7:15)
item.description: Part 30 explains how to use the glob function to get a list of files in a directory that match a certain extension type, eg .txt files only.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 31 - Upload a Script to a Server: Ascii, chmod (5:19)
item.description: Part 31 shows the steps to take to upload a perl script to your server. Ascii mode, chmod files and folders.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 32 - Printing a Block of Text (3:26)
item.description: Part 32 shows how to print a block of text with one print statement.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 33 - File Test Operators: -e, -z, -s, -d (6:52)
item.description: Part 33 talks about file test operators: -e, -z, -s and -d.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 34 - chmod Function: Set File Permissions (5:50)
item.description: Part 34 explains the chmod function and how to set read, write and execute permissions for files and folders.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 35 - Sendmail: Send an Email, Rudewords Filter (9:55)
item.description: Part 35 shows how to use sendmail to send and recieve email from a script securely. Plus, how to remove HTML tags from the email message, and how to create a rudewords filter.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 36 - Create a Form where Method=Post (9:59)
item.description: Part 36 shows how to create a form for the web where method=post that we will learn how to parse in the next tutorial.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 37 - Parse a Form where Method=Post (6:31)
item.description: Part 37 shows how to parse the web form from the previous tutorial where method=post and print out the data.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 38 - Create a Form where Method=Get (5:07)
item.description: Part 38 shows how to create a form for the web where method=get that we will learn how to parse in the next tutorial.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 39 - Parse a Form where Method=Get (7:18)
item.description: Part 39 shows how to parse the web form from the previous tutorial where method=get and print out the result.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 40 - Create & Parse a Simple Query String (4:09)
item.description: Part 40 shows how to create and parse a simple and concise query string.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 41 - Environmental Variables (6:34)
item.description: Part 41 explains how to capture and use environmental variables in your scripts.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 42 - require Function (5:15)
item.description: Part 42 shows the use of the require function to read information from other scripts.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 43 - Install a Module with CPAN.pm .LOCK NMAKE (9:13)
item.description: Part 43 shows how to use CPAN.pm to install a perl module on your computer as well as point out some minor problems like the .LOCK file and the NMAKE error and how to fix them.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 44 - LWP::Simple - Get Web Page Source Code (4:07)
item.description: Part 44 shows how to use the LWP::Simple module to get a web pages source code.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 45 - Fetch, Parse & Convert a Web Page to Text (9:30)
item.description: Part 45 shows how to use the LWP::Simple ,HTML::TreeBuilder and HTML::FormatText modules to download, parse and format a web page into plain text.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 46 - LWP::UserAgent - Emulate a Browser (5:49)
item.description: Part 46 shows how to use the LWP::UserAgent module to emulate a browser and download a web pages source code.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 47 - IO::Socket - Connect to a Web Server (7:44)
item.description: Part 47 shows how to use the IO::Socket module to connect to a web server and download a web page.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 48 - HTML::LinkExtor - Extract Links & Images (7:17)
item.description: Part 48 shows how to use the HTML::LinkExtor module to extract the links and images from a web page.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 49 - HTML::HeadParser - Extract Title & Meta (7:13)
item.description: Part 49 shows how to use the HTML::HeadParser module to extract the title, description, keywords, content type meta data etc. from between the head tags of a web page.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 50 - Download a Website to Your Computer (9:59)
item.description: Part 50 shows how to use several modules to download multiple web pages to html files to view offline on your computer or to create a mirror site.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 51 - Create & Work with a Flat File Database (9:58)
item.description: Part 51 shows how to create and work with a simple flat file database.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 52 - CGI.pm - Generate HTML on the Fly (7:26)
item.description: Part 52 explores the CGI.pm module to create html tag shortcuts and to generate html web pages on the fly.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 53 - CGI.pm - Meta, Body, Image, Link & Format (9:43)
item.description: Part 53 continues to explore the CGI.pm module to create meta tags, body attributes, images, links and formatting.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 54 - CGI.pm - Generate Tables on the Fly (7:00)
item.description: Part 54 explores the CGI.pm module to create tables.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 55 - CGI.pm - Generate Forms on the Fly (8:02)
item.description: Part 55 explores the CGI.pm module to create forms starting with a text box, password box, radio buttons and check boxes.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 56 - CGI.pm - Generate Forms Continued (6:19)
item.description: Part 56 explores the CGI.pm module to create forms continuing with a scroll box, text area, hidden field, submit and reset buttons.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 57 - CGI.pm - Parse a Form (7:18)
item.description: Part 57 uses the CGI.pm module to parse a form.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 58 - CGI.pm - Generate Frames on the Fly (4:33)
item.description: Part 58 explores the CGI.pm module to generate a frameset and frames on the fly.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 59 - CGI.pm - Generate an Image Map (9:58)
item.description: Part 59 explores the CGI.pm module to generate an image map.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 60 - CGI.pm - Set & Read Cookies (5:57)
item.description: Part 60 explores the CGI.pm module to set and read cookies.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 61 - CGI.pm - File Uploads via Upload Form (9:36)
item.description: Part 61 explores the CGI.pm module to create an upload form and upload files to your server.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 62 - CGI.pm - Browser Redirection (2:22)
item.description: Part 62 explores the CGI.pm module to redirect a browser.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 63 - CGI.pm - Return an Image From a Script (7:16)
item.description: Part 63 explores the CGI.pm module to return an image from a script.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 64 - Benchmark Your Code (9:59)
item.description: Part 64 shows a few methods to benchmark your code.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 65 - Redirect the Browser with Location (1:45)
item.description: Part 65 shows how to redirect the browser with Location.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 66 - File::Find - Find Files & Directories (8:44)
item.description: Part 66 shows how to use the File::Find module to find and search for files and directories on your computer or server.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 67 - Perl Package Manager PPM: Install Modules (3:48)
item.description: Part 67 shows how to install, remove and upgrade modules with the Perl Package Manager - PPM.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 68 - Date::Calc - Date Functions & Calendar (9:21)
item.description: Part 68 shows how to use the Date::Calc module to easily create a calendar, work out date differences, print dates, if leap year or not, if a valid time or not and much more.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 69 - File::Compare - Compare 2 Files Contents (5:23)
item.description: Part 69 shows how to use the File::Compare module to easily check if two files contents are exactly the same.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 70 - Business::CreditCard - Check Credit Cards (6:52)
item.description: Part 70 shows how to use the Business::CreditCard module to validate a credit card, get card type and generate the last digit checksum number.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 71 - Formats: Create Text Formats (9:30)
item.description: Part 71 shows how to use Perl formats. Easily left and right justify and center text. Create your own text formats.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 72 - Formats: Text Slices (4:24)
item.description: Part 72 shows how to use text slices with Perl formats. Easily format a long string of text.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 73 - Formats: Create a Multiline List (5:01)
item.description: Part 73 shows how to use Perl formats to create a multiline list.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 74 - Formats: Create a Document Header (6:06)
item.description: Part 74 shows how to use Perl formats to create a document header with a multiline list and write it to file.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 75 - Formats: Create a Multipage Report (8:47)
item.description: Part 75 shows how to use Perl formats to create a multipage report from a datafile that can be printed out on a printer.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 76 - Formats: Low-Level Formatting - Formline (3:47)
item.description: Part 76 shows how to use Perl formats to create low-level formatting with the formline function.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 77 - Hard References (7:23)
item.description: Part 77 shows how to create hard references to variables, arrays, hashes and subroutines and how to de-reference those references and access the data.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 78 - Symbolic References (6:38)
item.description: Part 78 shows how to create symbolic references to variables, arrays, hashes and subroutines and how to de-reference those references and access the data.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 79 - Typeglobs (6:12)
item.description: Part 79 shows how to create and use typeglobs.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 80 - Anonymous Arrays, Hashes & Subroutines (4:45)
item.description: Part 80 shows how to create and use anonymous arrays, hashes and subroutines.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 81 - Reference a Typeglob & Other Data Types (5:23)
item.description: Part 81 shows how to create and use references to typeglobs and file handles. Also shows some other data types such as lvalue and code.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 82 - References Using the Symbol Table (9:51)
item.description: Part 82 shows how to create references and de-reference references using the symbol table.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 83 - De-Reference Using the Arrow Operator (9:58)
item.description: Part 83 shows how to de-reference references using the arrow operator and how to omit the arrow operator when accessing multi-dimensional arrays.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 84 - Pass Multiple Arrays to Sub. by Reference (7:52)
item.description: Part 84 shows how to pass and return multiple arrays to a subroutine by reference.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 85 - Ref Operater: Determine Data Type (9:56)
item.description: Part 85 shows how to use the ref operator to determine the type of data that a reference refers to.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 86 - Closures: Initialize Subroutine with Data (3:47)
item.description: Part 86 explains the use of closures to initialize a subroutine with data before using it and retain the scope of lexical variables.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 87 - Function Templates (3:45)
item.description: Part 87 shows how to create function templates using closures. A bit like generating subroutines on the fly.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 88 - Declaring Subroutines (6:29)
item.description: Part 88 shows how to declare subroutines and how to call the subroutine from above or below the subroutine code.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 89 - Subroutine Prototypes (10:01)
item.description: Part 89 shows how subroutine prototypes work. Define the type of data accepted by a subroutine.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 90 - Reading Arguments Passed to Subroutines (8:34)
item.description: Part 90 shows some of the ways to read arguments passed to subroutines.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 91 - Returning Values from Subroutines (7:43)
item.description: Part 91 shows how to return values from subroutines with 'return'.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 92 - Set Scope with My & Local in Subroutines (9:58)
item.description: Part 92 shows how to set the scope of variables with the 'my' and 'local' keywords in subroutines.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 93 - Arrays of Arrays (9:59)
item.description: Part 93 shows how to create and use multidimensional arrays of arrays.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 94 - Hashes of Hashes (7:35)
item.description: Part 94 shows how to create and use multidimensional hashes of hashes.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 95 - Arrays of Hashes (7:50)
item.description: Part 95 shows how to create and use multidimensional arrays of hashes.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 96 - Hashes of Arrays (6:20)
item.description: Part 96 shows how to create and use multidimensional hashes of arrays.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 97 - Chop & Chomp (4:42)
item.description: Part 97 explains and demonstrates the chop and chomp functions.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 98 - STDIN: Read Typed Input (7:30)
item.description: Part 98 shows how to read typed input with STDIN.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 99 - The For Loop (6:22)
item.description: Part 99 explains how the 'for' loop works.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 100 - Store Data Structures on Disk (8:45)
item.description: Part 100 shows how to store data structures on disk with the storable module and how to retrieve them later.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 101 - Data::Dumper - Print Data Structures (6:09)
item.description: Part 101 uses the Data::Dumper module to print out data structures.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 102 - Copy a Data Structure (4:38)
item.description: Part 102 shows how to copy data structures.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 103 - Write & Read a Database File (9:50)
item.description: Part 103 shows how to write and read a database file.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 104 - Sort Databases (9:22)
item.description: Part 104 shows how to sort databases.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 105 - Text File Database (6:03)
item.description: Part 105 shows how to create a text file database.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 106 - Encryption Using Crypt Function (7:53)
item.description: Part 106 uses the crypt function to encrypt a string.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 107 - Pattern Matching: Pre-Match / Post-Match (4:58)
item.description: Part 107 uses predefined variables in pattern matching to find a match, pre-match and post-match in a string.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 108 - Output Field Separators (4:16)
item.description: Part 108 uses the predefined variables output field separators for the print operator and array values.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 109 - Current Input Line Number (5:17)
item.description: Part 109 makes use of the current input line number predefined variable to count or fetch a number of records from a file.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 110 - Output Record Separator (4:12)
item.description: Part 110 uses the output record separator predefined variable to separate records easily.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 111 - Default Variable (8:36)
item.description: Part 111 explains the default variable which is the most used predefined variable in perl.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 112 - Regex: Match a Digit, Word & White Space (10:00)
item.description: Part 112 demonstrates some regular expressions such as matching the beginning and end of a line, match a digit, match a word character, match white space and match any character.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 113 - Regex: Character Classes (10:01)
item.description: Part 113 demonstrates regular expressions character classes.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 114 - Regex: Alternative Match Patterns (7:58)
item.description: Part 114 demonstrates regular expressions alternative match patterns.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 115 - Regex: Quantifiers (10:00)
item.description: Part 115 demonstrates regular expressions quantifiers.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 116 - Regex: Assertions (9:34)
item.description: Part 116 demonstrates the use of regular expressions assertions.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 117 - Regex: Backreferences (7:47)
item.description: Part 117 demonstrates the use of regular expressions backreferences to refer to previous successful matches.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 118 - Regex: Backreferences Continued (5:52)
item.description: Part 118 demonstrates the use of regular expressions backreferences to refer to previous matches, 2nd part.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 119 - Regex: Lookahead & Lookbehind Assertions (6:47)
item.description: Part 119 demonstrates the use of regular expressions lookahead and lookbehind assertions.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 120 - Regex: pos Function and \G Assertion (9:56)
item.description: Part 120 demonstrates the use of regular expressions pos function and the \G assertion.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 121 - Regex: e Modifier - Make Function Calls (6:16)
item.description: Part 121 demonstrates how to use function calls and expressions inside regular expressions with the e modifier.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 122 - Regex: ee Modifier (7:23)
item.description: Part 122 demonstrates the use of the ee modifier in regular expressions.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 123 - Regex: x Modifier - Add Comments (5:33)
item.description: Part 123 shows how to use the x modifier in regular expressions to allow whitespace and comments to make regex's easier to read and understand.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 124 - Regex: o Modifier - Compile Pattern Once (4:05)
item.description: Part 124 shows how to use the o modifier in regular expressions to compile the regex only once.

item.title: Perl Tutorial 125 - Regex: qr Operator - Compile Expressions (8:25)
item.description: Part 125 shows how to use the qr operator to create compiled regular expressions.
